bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, August 29, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests that Tisdel send him a copy of a Congressional report.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, August 29, 1941
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
August 29, 1941
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
Mr. Alton P. Tisdel
Superintendent of Documents
U. S. Government Printing Office
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Tisdel:
div1.p:
Is it possible for me to obtain a copy of
Report No. 1429, 70th Congress, 1st Session, House
of Representatives, entitled “To recognize the high
public service rendered by Maj. Walter Reed and those
associated with him,....”.
If so, I should be delighted to receive it.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. RECIEVED
SUPERINTENDENT DOCUMENTS
SEP
12
1941
psh:ds
